'Mickey' - You were awesome. Period. Thanks for making me genuinely feel welcome.
'Sarah' - You had the best story of all, and I loved every second of it. Follow your dream kiddo. If anyone can do it, you can!
'Tommy' the roulettes dealer - You never missed a beat. I would have seen more of the show if you weren't so damn much fun to gamble with. And cute to boot!
Seriously, if there's any tickets left, you should totally go do this. It's sooo SF, it's sooo well done and it's sooo awesome, I guarantee you you won't be disappointed.
author: Stephen S.

description: A TRULY unique experience, a total evening of fun! Urge everyone to dress in period attire and get immersed in this wonderful slice of 1920's performance art.  Song, dance, schtick, drink, gamble, gossip, drama - you get it all.  Special kudos to the Cabaret M.C., Chanteuse and Kirby  - the cut-up Catskill like second banana.  And speaking of bananas; well YOU GOTTA SEE IT !!
author: William D.

description: one of the most unique and awesome theater events i've ever been to.  it is truly immersive and you feel like you are really transported to another time and place.
author: vlad k.

description: Go. Just go. Went with my husband last night, after party and everything. I was hesitant to pay the ticket price without really understanding what I was getting myself in to, but wow am I glad I did. They do this so, so very well that it really is a completely unique experience. I won't give anything away, but this really is something you shouldn't miss. Please do follow the rules though, it makes the whole thing so much more incredible for everyone.
author: Jess L.

description: This brings you back in time to the era...dress in the attire of the time makes it so much more fun...soo much going on you could go more than once and see an entire different performance ..in the bar , casino or cabaret ... A must see !!before it ends!
author: Debby F.

description: My husband and I went last night and had a great adventure!  It started off a little slowly as quite a big group was gathered at the first location and it took some time to get the info on where to go next, (I wonder if some people arrived before their time) but we all arrived in plenty of time for the first "act".  The set was amazing.  Everything from the secret entrance, the bar, the 2 level cabaret, the casino, and the dressing room were really well done.  It felt very authentic.  You start the evening in either the bar or the caberet.  We were in the bar, and that was my favorite part of the evening.  All the storylines start in this first part and it is easy to follow.  After that it is a bit more challenging.  Other reviewers have suggested picking one storyline to follow, and I wish I had read that first.  It was hard to manuver around because the rooms are small and I kept feeling like a just missed something important.  Part of the problem was that their bathroom was out of order so we had to wait and be taken by groups 2 blocks down the road.  I think I missed 1/2 hour or more of the show -- and my reserved seating at the caberet.  I'm sure they will fix the bathroom problem ASAP though.  It was hard to tell when it was time to go to your reserved seating, so probably the best time to make a reservation is for the first part of the show.  After that, it really doesn't make too much difference.  The acting was great and the musical performances were fun.  We tried to enter the casino a few times, but were told it was closed.  I'm not sure if that was part of the bathroom problem or if it is only opened at the very end of the night.  So, we were a bit disappointed to miss the whole casino part, especially after buying chips.  But, we still had a great time.  I wish there was some way to find out what happened to all the stories/characters.  Be sure to dress in period outfits.  Only a few people didn't and they stood out.  Dress cooly -- it gets very warm in there, especially in the bar.  Sit in the cabaret near the door to the patio, if you are gettting too warm.  I hear it's ending soon due to the building being sold.  I hope they can find a new, bigger place to continue the show.
author: P S.
